snippet: Health groups are pushing a ballot initiative to impose a $1-a-pack tax, provoking a storm of advertisements to defeat the biggest threat the industry has faced in the state in a decade.
abstract: Array of health and anticancer groups have rallied behind a ballot initiative in California to impose a new $1-a-pack cigarette tax to finance cancer research; move would be the first tax increase in 14 years and has provoked a $47 million storm of advertisements, overwhelmingly financed by the tobacco industry; latest frontier in the fight against smoking is a very unlikely place, as California has long been identified with championing restrictions on smoking.
lead_paragraph: Health groups are pushing a ballot initiative to impose a $1-a-pack tax, provoking a storm of advertisements to defeat the biggest threat the industry has faced in the state in a decade.

headline.seo: In California, a Battle Over a Plan for $1-a-Pack Cigarette Tax
headline.main: A $1 Cigarette Tax Starts a $47 Million Brawl in California
headline.print_headline: Vote on $1 Cigarette Tax Starts A $47 Million California Brawl
